page.title: 05Farming
page.content: The farms,some of which are tenant farms are between 100&200 acres. Crops of hay and silage are grown but very little corn. The grassland mostly actively maintained but with some rough grazing, carries eight milking herds. These are mostly Hereford X Fresians,but one is pure Jersey.There are two Hereford bulls and occasional Charolais. One owner takes heifers on contract, serves them by his bull, keeps them till they calve, and returns them. Many young stock are reared for beef. There are six flocks of sheep numbering 10 to 200. Pheasants are reared on one farm. There is one bee keeper.Some riding horses are kept.A riding centre has a number of horses for hire. There are 3 small holdings and a nursery garden producing poultry plants vegetables fruit and flowers.
